column4: my lexmark printer driver worked on 32 bit ubuntu but is not working on 64 bit ubuntu
does it make sense that a driver can work on 32 bit ubuntu but not work on 64 bit ubuntu?
sure.
do the drivers say if they are for 32 or 64 because i have never seen that designation
a binary module is built against a certain architecture, just as any other executable would be. did you have a specific problem or example in mind?
where is the list of drivers that run on 64 bit ubuntu?

generally, drivers are built along with the kernel they augment. there is no 64-bit specific list of open source drivers, to my knowledge. the problem only comes up should you attempt to load a binary kernel module provided by a vendor.
the lexmark printer driver worked on my 32 bit ubuntu but does not work on my 64 bit Ubuntu
where did you get the driver from? it's a networked printer, or?
i got the driver from the lexmark website and it is not a networked printer
do i have to do this?  http://www.ehow.com/how_6800521_install-driver-ubuntu-64-bit.html
go back to their website, and be sure to fetch the correct driver. or contact their support desk.
they only have one ubuntu driver for my printer
it's possible you only need to install the 32-bit compatibility libraries. have you done so?
that is the link i showed you above
have you done so?
no
well, now you know how to proceed.
that link shows what i have to do?
it looks correct, yes.
i mean can i trust ehow? hahaha
ok will dop
